(7) Digital Transformation Definition

Digital Transformation means adapting an organization's strategy and structure to capture opportunities enabled by digital technology. (Nathan Furr and Andrew Shipilov, Digital Doesn't Have to Be Disruptive, Harvard Business Review 97(4), July/August 2019, pp. 94-103) [https://hbr.org/2019/07/digital-doesnt-have-to-be-disruptive]


The API Journey Erik Wilde (@dret): Digital Transformation:
Vision, Strategy, Program

(8) Digital Transformation Vision

Our Digital Transformation Initiative drives innovation by allowing us to more quickly develop and execute on new ideas. Innovation is the driving force that allows us to improve engagement with existing customers and to explore new markets.

The Digital Transformation Initiative will turn us into the leader of the industry. By increasing the number of customer touchpoints and using the resulting feedback to quickly and relentlessly adapt and improve our offerings, we will be able to outperform our competition and turn into the market leader within the next three years.



The API Journey Erik Wilde (@dret): Digital Transformation:
Vision, Strategy, Program

(13) Digital Transformation is Continuous

  • Digital transformation happens at two levels
    • Transforming the organization to become better at adapting to changes
    • Aligning IT with this new setup to more quickly deliver value
  • You're never done with digital transformation
    • Business must be empowered and capable to identify opportunities
    • Organization must be capable of acting fast to capture opportunities
    • Technology must be set up to realize opportunities quickly and safely

From A to B Erik Wilde (@dret): Digital Transformation:

(15) API Strategy Execution

  • Typical questions when going from A to B
    • A: Where are we starting?
    • B: Where do we want to go?
    • Progress: How far along are we?
  • Digital transformation is no waterfall and never ends
    • Start: Identify priorities, make small steps, and reassess often
    • Goal: Minimizing the time from ideation to production
    • Progress: Listen to teams, identify bottlenecks, and provide support


From A to B Erik Wilde (@dret): Digital Transformation:
Vision, Strategy, Program

(20) Necessary, but not Sufficient

  • APIs are necessary, but not sufficient for digital transformation
  • APIs are most effective when there is a continuously managed API landscape
  • The Catalyst's only mission is to improve customer success


Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): Digital Transformation:
Vision, Strategy, Program
